00018 #ifndef EQUIVALENCEPARTITION_H
00019 #define EQUIVALENCEPARTITION_H
00020 
00029 template<class T>
00030 class EquivalencePartition : public std::vector<std::set<T> > {
00031 public:
00032   typedef typename std::set<T>                  EquivalenceClass;
00033   using   std::vector<std::set<T> >::size;
00034   using   std::vector<std::set<T> >::begin;
00035   
00036   int   equate(const T &, const T &);   // equate two objects
00037   int   equivalenceClass(const T &) const; // find the equiv. class of an obj
00038   int   newClass();                     // create a new equivalence class
00039   bool  insert(int, const T &);         // insert obj into given class
00040   int   merge(int, int);                // merge two equivalence classes
00041 };
00042 
00049 template<class T>
00050 int EquivalencePartition<T>::equivalenceClass(const T &x) const {
00051   int i;
00052 
00053   for(i = 0; i<size(); ++i) {
00054     if((*this)[i].find(x) != (*this)[i].end()) {
00055       return(i);
00056     }
00057   }
00058   return(-1);
00059 }
00060 
00061 
00067 template<class T>
00068 int EquivalencePartition<T>::newClass() {
00069   std::set<T> emptySet;
00070   push_back(emptySet);
00071   return(size()-1);
00072 }
00073 
00074 
00080 template<class T>
00081 bool EquivalencePartition<T>::insert(int i, const T &x) {
00082   return(((*this)[i].insert(x)).second);
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00092 template<class T>
00093 int EquivalencePartition<T>::equate(const T &x, const T &y) {
00094   int xclass = equivalenceClass(x);
00095   int yclass = equivalenceClass(y);
00096 
00097   if(xclass < 0) {
00098     if(yclass < 0) {                    // neither exist yet
00099       xclass = newClass();
00100       insert(xclass, x);
00101       insert(xclass, y);      
00102     } else {                            // y exists, x doesn't
00103       insert(yclass, x);
00104       return(yclass);
00105     }
00106   } else {
00107     if(yclass < 0) {                    // x exists, y doesn't
00108       insert(xclass, y);
00109     } else {                            // both exist
00110       xclass = merge(xclass, yclass);
00111     }
00112   }
00113   return(xclass);
00114 }
00115 
00116 
00122 template<class T>
00123 int EquivalencePartition<T>::merge(int i, int j) {
00124   if(i > j) {
00125     int t;
00126     t = i; i = j; j = t;
00127   }
00128   if(i == j) return(i);
00129 
00130   (*this)[i].insert((*this)[j].begin(), (*this)[j].end());
00131   erase(begin() + j);
00132   return(i);
00133 }
00134 
00135 
00138 template<class T>
00139 std::ostream &operator <<(std::ostream &out, const EquivalencePartition<T> &E){
00140   typename EquivalencePartition<T>::const_iterator it;
00141   typename EquivalencePartition<T>::EquivalenceClass::const_iterator cit;
00142 
00143   for(it = E.begin(); it != E.end(); ++it) {
00144     out << '{';
00145     for(cit = it->begin(); cit != it->end(); ++cit) {
00146       out << " " << *cit; 
00147     }
00148     out << " }" << std::endl;
00149   }
00150   return(out);
00151 }
